meanings.sent1: She rebuffed his idea without even considering it.
meanings.sent2: He felt hurt when she rebuffed his offer to help.
meanings.sent3: The cat rebuffed the dog's attempt to play with a playful swat.
meanings.sent4: Her cold stare rebuffed any attempts at conversation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern tone rebuffed any further questions.

meanings.definition: Refuse or reject in an abrupt or ungracious manner
meanings.sent1: He rebuffed her invitation to the party rudely.
meanings.sent2: She rebuffed his apology with a dismissive wave of her hand.
meanings.sent3: The robot rebuffed the commands, causing frustration for its owner.
meanings.sent4: The closed door seemed to rebuff any hope of entry.
meanings.sent5: The knight rebuffed the enemy's attack with a swift counterstrike.
